text: Only nature knows how to justly proportion to the fault the punishment it deserves.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: Out with stereotypes, feminism proclaims. But stereotypes are the west's stunning sexual personae, the vehicles of art's assault against nature. The moment there is imagination, there is myth.
author: Camille Paglia

text: All, all is theft, all is unceasing and rigorous competition in nature the desire to make off with the substance of others is the foremost - the most legitimate - passion nature has bred into us and, without doubt, the most agreeable one.
author: Marquis de Sade

text: We are learning, too, that the love of beauty is one of Nature's greatest healers.
author: Ellsworth Huntington
